N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2606.3 - Identification of eligible project categories

State Regulations
(a) A project will be eligible for State
assistance if it is within one or more of the eligible project categories as
determined by the corporation pursuant to this section. (b) The corporation will publish in the

Environmental Notice Bulletin and the State Register a notice of availability
of a draft description of eligible project categories for the FAB Program. Such
draft will describe the specific categories of projects to be funded under the
FAB Program including a description of the facilities or equipment potentially
eligible for State assistance; the amount of, or formula for determining, the

State assistance available for each eligible project; specific eligibility
criteria; and specific project requirements and project priority information, if any. (c) The public will be
allowed at least 30 calendar days to comment on such draft. (d) After the comment period has expired and
the comments have been considered: (1)

The
corporation shall publish in the Environmental Notice Bulletin and the State

Register a notice of availability of the final description of eligible project
categories. Such notice will specify the time period during which the
corporation will accept requests for financial assistance for projects within
one or more of the eligible project categories set forth in the draft
description of eligible project categories; and specify or instruct the reader
how to obtain from the corporation information regarding the amount of, or
formula for determining, the State assistance available for each eligible
project; specific eligibility criteria; and specific project requirements and
project priority information, if any. (2)

Alternatively, the corporation shall
publish in the Environmental Notice Bulletin and the State Register a notice
extending the comment period or soliciting comments on a different eligible
project category. Notes
